Customer Review.undefined: I've never tired to call in for support but if you don't offer that, that could be something to offer.
Nothing.  Important things are there.  Great displays of the products and how they work.  Also being able to down load the manual without having to purchase first is very important.
to date was always very satisfied and have nothing to suggest for improvement.
Nothing comes to mind at the moment.
If you order from Canada show that there are extra cost to get the quipment.
Just keep doing what you are doing. Don't outsource or offshore your customer service.

1) have the Settings Utility work with all your products
2) emphasize the maximum length of the setup.html password, maybe with a text box in the setup.html screen; I spent a lot of time figuring out why the products were not accepting a 12 character password  :-(
Could not create an account until I placed an order......Still buggs me
See it to a successful conclusion. Put more boxes for free-range commentary otherwise you only hear an echo.
I have no complaints, suggestions about the service I have received.  The devices are robust and work as designed and when I have some issue with programming it is a conflict I created.
just keep it as it is
Your sales customer service is perfect! Your engineering customer service needs a hearing aid!
Better to regularly release product information, now technology applications, and the case sharing.
I don't think you need to!
I think you are doing a good job, but like all others we can always do better.
No improvement necessary.  Perhaps an RMA process, however we have had no need for an RMA which reflects on a robust product.
Highly recommend the use of the company's products
Nothing, has been a great experience.
More Erics - I appreciate his help and promptness. A+++

Have more detailed tutorials maybe on Youtube you give step by step how to set your products up. It is pretty techie to set most of them up. If it is a step by step detailed tutorial I think that would save time for the tech's and customers.
Can’t think of anything at the moment
It is best to provide a set of application instances for a full range of the products.
I've had nothing but good experiences with customer service.
Nothing.  Keep it the way it is.
Not much, it seems to be great
Better online faq and problem databases. I like your folks but want to access more info on the web.
I like to interact by email or text - not phone so much.

We suffer the same issue, which is working out who is a legitimate tech and long term customer and who is a cheap arse tyre kicker.....Having a technician support phone number/email address as opposed to a publicly available one advertised on the internet would be tops. Nothing worse than as a tech getting the "have you restarted it" line when you are on site and shit is going pear shaped.

Im in Australia, Shane is always very helpful and always answers but like everyone cant always answer everything...neither can I :)

Lately due to reorganization and staffing issues I assume, it’s more difficult to get through when calling. I trust email tech support only will never be an option…precisely why I left my former provider and sought out CBW.
Nothing.  Keep them happy and keep doing what you’re doing.
I can find nothing to improve.
You could provide 24/7 support to customers who rely upon their sensors and related devices for critical functions, e.g., monitoring bilge water level.

Interview Quotes.Quote: I claim myself to be an automation junkie, and ControlByWeb has really taken what’s possible to another level. I’ve yet to concoct a scheme that ControlByWeb hasn’t brought to reality.
I don’t think there’s anything that ControlByWeb can’t do.
Every time I come across some harebrained idea that might work for these modules, I run it by Eric and he's like, 'yeah, use this module.
Some of these devices that aren't [ControlByWeb] devices have issues connecting with [Ignition], but your devices are green all across the board.

While testing several well-known PLC manufacturers, we've selected WebRelay as a vital component for the ACS solution because it fits perfectly into the frp®acs access control architecture and seamlessly integrates with our cloud and edge solutions. The WebRelay-based access control solution is fast, stable, multi-purpose, and scalable, which is crucial for our customers.
[Working with ControlByWeb] was a great experience due to prompt and super-professional feedback from their support team.
The whole system together gives the storage manager the tools they need to be able to successfully store the product at the optimal conditions.
The hardest part is having to train my guys to handle worst-case scenarios, and then they never actually deal with any of them.
[Letter to ControlByWeb featured in the September customer experience article.]

I use these exclusively for small water and off-grid power management systems, perfect for these types of systems and simple to program with all the powerful attributes of SCADA on a smaller scale. That being said, CBW has one of the best tech support teams I have seen. I have programmed plenty of ladder code and function block programming in my work career but for simple and fairly complex applications CBW has got a great product. To sum it up I wouldn’t use CBW for a 5-axis robot, CNC application, or multi-axis motion control, but it lends itself well to the layman’s understanding of the controls world and quick development and deployment of control systems.
I use [ControlByWeb] exclusively for small water and off-grid power management systems [they’re] simple to program with all the powerful attributes of SCADA on a smaller scale.
CBW has one of the best tech support teams I have seen.

I have programmed plenty of ladder code and function block programming in my work career but for simple and fairly complex applications CBW has got a great product. … I wouldn’t use CBW for a 5-axis robot, CNC application, or multi-axis motion control, but it lends itself well to the layman’s understanding of the controls world and quick development and deployment of control systems. – Randy Simpson

General Product Review.undefined: Question 4: What could we do to improve our product?
Remote firmware upgradable.  Add a remote boot option. Put the system time on the control page
Firmware upgrades work as directed but are cumbersome and labor intense.  Simplifing this would help.

The x-410 is, unfortunately not a great upgrade from the X-300, even though the "task-based" GUI alternate to basic scripting might seem like an improvement, it would have been better just to publish more sample basic scripts for users to see.  A temp control relay is not going to have an infinite number of variables: mostly just time, indoor and outdoor conditions and occupancy, maybe. I'm sad to see the X-300 discontinued.
Keep doing what you are doing. greats products, great customer support. THANKS

Made in the U.S.A. what a novel idea. Perhaps you could somehow trade/license your expertise with other U.S. based manufacturers. Disseminate the good news. Besides reliably performing their intended function the products possess an attractive appearance, fit and feel.
Find another product from another company
The plastic used for the DIN rail clips was very hard, so it just wouldn't flex enough to clip on. We ended up mounting it on a couple of screws.

X-410 Product Review.undefined: Question 4: What else would you like to tell us about the X-410?

I believe it needs newer security updates to accommodate encryption on the network. Also, the password two-factor authentication and/or radius. We are looking forward to MQTT so that there is security built into the communication between devices.
I have x410s deployed all over Alaska and I haven’t broken one yet.
